reviews.review_msg: His slides are too hard to follow - literally paragraphs. There is ALOT of material in this course but we only got tested on random select topics. There is are 2 midterms (one for each textbook), a term paper, and a final presentation. The presentation is recorded and marked very harshly. Good luck if you take a class with him..

He is the hardest prof ever in linguistics department. His exams were really hard, you must understand all the materials prior to class, otherwise, you will have no ideas what hes talking about in class.
His lecture notes were difficult to understand, but the contents were not that hard. If you read the textbooks you will be fine. HOWEVER I do not recommend anyone to take this class with him.

Only take his classes if you are taking school seriously. He is a tough prof and marks are not easy to get. Attending class is a MUST to get a decent mark. 3 hour lecture but he tries to break it up for you with group discussions and administrative stuff to mix it up. I took Ling 200 with him before.

He is a horrible teacher. I've had four classes with him so far. He is rude and has a cheesy and boring sense of humour. His exams are extremely hard for the courses he teaches (i've had a 100 class with him before.) Don't take his class if you can help it.

Great prof.  He might seem a little stand-offish in class, but is very approachable and gives so much help if you go and talk to him. Tests are difficult, but fair.  He gave study guides for all his lectures, so if you devote enough time to studying them, you'll be fine.

Clear prof with decent notes. Quizzes fair, but on final some really tricky stuff we barely glanced at in class. He thinks he's always right, so if you disagree, it's VERY hard to get him to change his mind (or your mark!)

He cracks too many stupid jokes, and hes usually the only one laughing. He's got great notes, very good/clear weekly summary notes that he posts on his webpage. He knows his stuff really well. Not an easy marker though, his questions are demanding.

• This is Claudia's main area of study/research, so her teaching of the course was amazing.
• I learned a lot about the field of applied ling!
• Group project was interesting to do (I enjoyed my topic), but make sure to find a good group. The presentations are 20 minutes, and so it's important to pull ur weight.

Ive taken three classes (LING111, 200) so far with her. Depending on her TAs, her classes are easy due to no participation grades and no exams. Shes got an attitude towards students who dont show up to class and/or dont participate in discussions. The group projects suck. If you prefer getting marks and feedback before the sem ends, avoid her.

One of the best professor at SFU. Her lectures are very organized. I really get to know the materials. Another professor has taught me related knowledge as well, but he made me confused. The tests are hard but fair if you read the textbooks and pay attention to the lectures.
Trude is one of the best profs I've had at sfu. Her lectures are very organized and very entertaining.
Classes are long, but content is interesting.  The tests are difficult, especially if studying is last minute.  Marking is fair.  Super kind and helpful.

Pros - Her lecture notes were copied and pasted from the textbooks. Her exams were very difficult. Cons - She does know a lot about the topic and her classes are fun and engaging. She is nice and available for help.

Dasha is such a great prof! Her lectures were interesting and not too long, 1hr a week. Homework and group participation are free marks. Quizzes are easy, too, as long as you watch the lecture. The exams were set up nicely, with the MC portion first, a 10-min break, and then the written part. Final projects were really interesting! Recommend her!

Dasha is an awesome prof. For online LING 360 class she pre-released her 1 hr lectures for student to finish on their own time (a day before the live class). I like it because I can pause the video and take the best notes I've ever had. Then we have a live class where we discuss the content and work in groups. She organizes canvas really well.
